title: The 10 Vegetables To Grow That Will Really Feed You!

subtasks: Research and choose vegetables to plant (Natalie and Chloe's initial thought)
Discuss winter squash planting and care (including pumpkin, butternuts, buttercups)
Mention bean varieties and their nitrogen-fixing benefits
Explain sweet potato cultivation and storage (e.g., curing after harvest)
Highlight greens like kale, cabbage, and edible weeds (chokecherry mentioned as an example)
Describe corn as a staple crop, emphasizing heirloom varieties and processing
Detail zucchini and summer squash productivity and versatile uses
Encourage tomato growing, discussing raw and processed uses
Advise on garlic cultivation, benefits as a food and medicine
Promote potato growing, referencing Pablo Neruda's "enemies of hunger" line
Recommend root crops (beets, daikon, turnips, parsnips) and storage methods (e.g., sawdust, fermentation)
Mention the Wild Abundance Online Gardening School's full class on the topic
Provide class information and website (wildabundance.net) for further learning
